website_summaries.verdict: This unit has a tempered glass lid that lets you keep an eye on your rice while it's cooking, as well as a generously-sized steamer basket – two features other models lack.
pros: Steams meat and vegetables while rice cooks below
Cooks between 2 and 6 cups of any kind of rice
3 cup capacity depends upon variety of rice
cons: No audible signal when cooking stops
Must unplug to turn the unit off

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: My rice cooks so awesome in just 25 min. I don't have to worry it overcooks because it turns off automatically when its ready and switches to keeping rice warm. I cooked my best Brussel sprouts yesterday using the steaming feature. It's awesome! I also successfully cooked green lentils, quinoa, buckwheat and millet. With beans I had to refill my pot with water twice to have it cooked right. It cooked for ~1 hour but tasted delicious. I will pre-soak the beans next time. It worked out well for the lentils too. This device is easy to clean and to store. It's completely silent and 100% reliable. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Tibor

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Horrible piece of junk. I bought this to replace an identical looking rival rice cooker that was finally worn out after 10 years of good service. This cooker failed after the second use when the spring holding the inner pot plate broke. When I looked at Aroma rice cooker reviews at any price point the reviews all pointed to hit and miss quality control and terrible customer service. I can only agree. I bought the Amazon recommended Hamilton Beach 6 cup cooker and am very pleased. It was a bit more expensive but the reviews for similar priced Aroma cookers were not encouraging - so at least I didn't waste more money buying another Aroma product.
customer_reviews.author: C.V.

customer_reviews.title: PRELIMINARY - Brand new and already missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooker brand new, sealed box. Upon unboxing, noticed it is missing one of the three black rubber studs that it has on its legs. Because of this, it does not sit leveled in the countertop. I have removed the other two rubber studs to level it. Will give it a try and see how it performs cooking and steaming. I will update this review in some time, after I have given the product a good run. In the meantime, I can say I am not completely satisfied with the purchase. I have owned other Aroma brand products before, this is why I am giving it a break before going into a full review on it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Really Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: It scorches the rice EVERY time. You can use it as a Steamer, but it is next to useless as a ricecooker. Even the steamer baskets quality sucks. I have only used the steamer a few times for eggs and it has outlines from where the eggs were that won't come off. I have only cooked rice in it 3 times and even though I followed cleaning instructions and only used rice spoon that came with it the coating is already coming off. I should have just put up the extra money to get a decent one for 50-60. This piece of junk isn't even worth the twenty something I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Bergfield

customer_reviews.title: I tried my best, it was just a terrible product. :(
customer_reviews.text: I tried my best to like this product. I would have returned it, but when I went to stir my rice the paddle that came along with the order melted. I tried this numerous times mind you, I didn’t want to give up after one go. The rice cooker splatters water everywhere and burns the rice every time. The button was troublesome to push down and most of the time stuck. When the button sticks it doesn’t stop cooking and could potentially burn your house down. Just awful, I had to throw it away, not even worth donating to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Mollusk

customer_reviews.title: “On” button melted on the first use
customer_reviews.text: The “on” button melted and made it unusable on the FIRST use. I had my old model for 12 years without problem!! I’m disappointed by the cheap workmanship on this one. Unfortunately I didn’t use it for the first time until the day after my Amazon return window closed. I contacted Arona, and they want me to send it back to them and they’ll check for manufacturing defects- if a defect is found, they’ll send me a replacement. If not, I’ll have to pay my own shipping for the to send the broken one back to me. Super complicated and annoying to get them to fix their problem.
customer_reviews.author: ZMomUtah

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, the food steamer had multiple dents. It also does not fit onto the rice cooker and as such cannot be used. Secondly, the cover does to fit either the rice cooker or the food steamer. It seems as if they just took up a random cover and put it in the box. when I received the item the box seemed to have "been through the wars". The box was torn and disfigured; very unsightly. Based on my experience I would not recommend it. I know it was not an expensive item but i at least expected for the pieces to fit together.
customer_reviews.author: RedPheonix

customer_reviews.title: Fails at the main thing it should do well
customer_reviews.text: Use it the way you're supposed to with the right amount of rice and water and you will end up with rice that is burned on the bottom. The unit switches to "keep warm" mode and during this time it continues to overheat the rice and burns it. Therefore...it does not do what it supposed to do. DO NOT GET SUCKERED IN BY THE PRICE BECAUSE ULTIMATELY YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR...WHICH IS NOT MUCH. While I didn't have issues with the unit spraying water on my kitchen wall the fact that it doesn't cook rice to a satisfactory completion is more important. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mentallo

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this several times since purchasing, and really like it. The rice comes out much better than the old covered pot method I used to use to make rice. As far as quantity of rice, the machine is on the smaller side so it's great for a single person or a small family. I haven't tried steaming veggies or meat in it yet, but will eventually. It cleans up very easily and is easy to use. Just be aware that it comes with it's own cup that doesn't equal eight ounces (it's not a standard measuring cup) - so always use the provided cup when measuring out rice and water as per the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Word of advice: Save Your $21.60
customer_reviews.text: I'm not entirely knocking this brand because I do happen to own a fantastic Aroma rice cooker/steamer that I had purchased from Costco and am very pleased with it. However, this particular model of the Aroma rice cooker/steamer that I just purchased on Amazon is subpar. For starters, the cooking mechanism shuts off before the liquid is absorbed into the rice. I had to turn it back on at least 4 times. Also, unless you like scorched rice, this model is NOT for you. Worthless piece of xxxx. Let the buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: MJ in CA

customer_reviews.title: Works fine like it’s supposed too
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little cooker! This works just like my old one I just needed something smaller and red to match my kitchen! For the folks complaining about mess lol well you must not be washing your rice and over filling it? Really there is no other reason all rice cookers work the same unless you invest in the big fancy boys! Wash your rice!
customer_reviews.author: sachet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you want a sticky dry rice GET THIS!!! I'm a Navy veteran that spent years overseas and this cooks rice in an authentic way, IMO. For the last 10 years, like a lot of Americans, I've been cooking rice in a pot on the stove top, and have not been getting the desired results. My stovetop rice always was really wet and either mushy or crunchy. This cooks the rice perfectly. Add 1, 2, or 3 cups (cup provided) and fill to the corresponding mark,in the removable pot, press the tab and presto.... PERFECTLY COOKED RICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This is defective
customer_reviews.text: This device spatters watery rice all over to a distance of 2 feet radius when it is cooking. I have used a rice cooker to make rice for the last 40 years. This is a defective item and I wish I could get my money back. Don't waste your money unless you love cleaning up sticky muck every time you use it. It is going in the garbage. It's easier to just cook rice in a pan. DEFECTIVE ITEM. And yes I push it down as much as possible but the spring in the bottom seems not to work.
customer_reviews.author: Doggie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Makes Jasmine rice beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Despite negative reviews, I've made PERFECT rice each time I've used this. I use the cup they gave and the right water measurements. I even used the coupon inside to purchase Jasmine rice. I only intend to use this for Jasmine rice. I know it claims to be able to do all this other stuff but honestly, I've got a real slow cooker for those things. I purchased this for Jasmine rice which it does beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Sundrip Journals

customer_reviews.title: It cooks fast!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing I s amazing!! I currently rent a room in someone’s house and I’m not too comfortable using their kitchen so I pretty much use this To cook in my room. It cooks everything super fast! I love this thing and I cook just about everything in it. Such as beans, rice, veggies and the Other day I made shrimp and potato curry. Perfect for cooking in your room... note that it’s not big at all but perfect for one maybe two people max.
customer_reviews.author: rose oscar

customer_reviews.title: The “warmer” device is a minus
customer_reviews.text: I am Asian and have been making rice for over 50 years the traditional way. The ‘’warmer’ which they tout to be such a greAt addition actually reduces the quality of the cooked rice. We traditionalists all know that when you shut off the heat to the rice, it should be left alone for 10 mins., allowing it to settle and steam without direct heat. Obviously, with continued heat, it makes the rice gummier, not fluffy. WHAT were they thinkin?
customer_reviews.author: Conscientious consumer

customer_reviews.title: Had since 2012
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker has been my helpful little friend since 2012. It recently shorted and died, but it helped me make dinner 100's of times in that 8 years. I actually teared up haha. It was affordable and reliable and one of the first cheap appliances I got myself as a young adult. It was so good and consistent, I fricken forgot how to even cook rice on the stove. Anyway, get this little rice cooker. It's awesome and reliable. 8 years isnt a bad life for a (at the time) $12.99 steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Wrenluv

customer_reviews.title: Aroma Housewares 6-Cup (Cooked) (3-Cup... Aroma Housewares
customer_reviews.text: No Timer shut off after cooking. Smell fumes from the Rice Cooker during cycling process. Note have to Unplug to prevent over heating. Rice Cooker inner base (Red Housing) . Where the pressure switch heats up the bottom of the rice cooker Bowl. For the price of this Unit, The over heating is a problem as other Reviewers mentioned. Hopefully , I don't have a "Lemon Unit" I have to May 30th to return this Rice Cooker. Was unable to Cancel shipment, No tracking Information provided. No Updates. Unprecedented Situation Will Update Review .....Pending 5/26/2018 10:45 AM : Contacted UPS Return Label authorization. UPS will pick Up Return Item Today 5/26/2018 By days end?.
customer_reviews.author: Shihan

customer_reviews.title: Rice Cooker cooks rice if you are able to turn it on.
customer_reviews.text: Works well if you can get the cook button to remain depressed. It has been erratic at best from Day-1. Sometimes days go by and it works great. Other times the cook button won’t remain depressed despite multiple attempts. Those are the times that I resort to cooking rice in the microwave. That frustrates me. Why would you market a rice cooker with a whole host of features when you have not designed it to remain on in the first place. Seems kind of dumb to me. It tells customers that the product would work well if you could get it to turn on. Imagine if GM/Ford sold cars using this business model. It is quite ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: The 21st Century Plum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me, it could be for you!
customer_reviews.text: Having a smal kitchen I Love having multipurpose equipment. First, I always try to find the middle ground or at least reasonabley priced items that will fit my needs and this certainly fits the bill. Second, hack can s ricer and steamer all in one and compact enough to save precious space is a winner! Easy to clean, easy to store and not complicated with all the bells and whistles more expensive models have. The choice is your. I made mine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fouracre

customer_reviews.title: Quick and delicious rice
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is amazingly compact for the amount of rice it makes. The price was reasonable, the cooker has a warming feature to turn the temperature down after it’s finished, and the Teflon cooking bowl is easy to clean. I dislike is the measuring lines on the side of the cooking bowl, though- it’s hard to tell if you are adding the right amount of rice and water. Special measuring cups would work better. All in all, this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: A cheap cooker that has a problem of boiling over
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay rice cooker for it's price, but it has the problem of boiling over and spitting out water through the vent. I've had other rice cookers and have made it my entire life (on stove/in a rice cooker) and got this one for a dorm lifestyle, but this cooker is just a problem. Even if you wash the rice to remove most of the starch and use the right amount of water, no matter what it'll boil over in this cooker. Even for a small cup of rice it'll do the same thing....I don't recommend getting this specific item. Go for quality instead of trying to cut it cheap guys.
customer_reviews.author: Chance

customer_reviews.title: My second rice cooker from Aroma
customer_reviews.text: I had this same rice cooker in black, but after 10+ years, the Teflon coating was not working well and oil spray was no longer enough to combat the rice/quinoa from sticking to the bottom. But, this is the perfect size for the two of us and I really like the unit. Solution was to buy a replacement unit, this time in red! Love it and will continue to use it!
customer_reviews.author: VickieG

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this. Super easy to use. It does keep cooking on the warm option so just make sure you take it off the warmer and pour into another bowl. The little shown in the cup was the bottom layer that got a little too brown because I didn’t take it out of the cooker right away. I don’t see that as a con... what I see as a con is cooking on stove and turning out mushy every single time.. this rice was PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect every time!
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with making rice. My pressure cooker burns it on the borrom, stovetop cooking, it always comes out different. Well let me tell you about this baby! It's fantastic. Perfect rice every time I use it! I love it and just the right size for the two of us. Put the water in add the rice and push the lever down and Preston when the lever comes up its donw!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: From a rice fan.
customer_reviews.text: Quick, simple review. This is based on my one time use and first impressions. Took about 30 minutes to steam both the rice and slices of chicken I placed in the upper level. Chicken came out really tender and the rice was soft and sticky. Probably the best rice I’ve had in a long time. Topped it all with lemon juice. The meal was great. Simple and delicious. If you love rice mixed with chicken, fish, veggies and the like, get this. Makes a delicious meal.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as I had never owned a rice cooker and wanted to start with an affordable one. This was the perfect price and size for my needs. Our household has only 3 people in it, I didn't need to be making 8 cups of rice for any reason. The cooker is super easy to use and to clean, and so far I've had nothing but perfect rice come out of it. It comes with a little steamer basket as well, but I haven't tried this part out yet. If you're looking for a basic, compact rice cooker that won't take up too much space and will be easy to clean, this one is just right!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Value for money but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: These are the best rice cookers for the price it is available for. I have been using one of these for a couple of years, the downside of it is the nonstick layer goes away pretty soon and rice starts to stick inside. It will make it harder to clean but this thing works for years. Just have to soak it in water for a couple of hours before cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Upahar J

customer_reviews.title: rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: has made cooking rice a lot easier and saved on the overflows that seem to always happen on the stove. you don't have to babysit the cooker - it beeps when done, so no burned rice like what happens occasionally on the stove even when you turn it down to low :) have used it a dozen times - worth the $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: 4 years of use
customer_reviews.text: Used this 4 years, and now the top steam rack is ruined from use. Pot itself did not hold up well, and the rice would burn to the bottom of the pot almost every time. The autocooking feature stays on a bit too long for most rice and will burn the bottom rice if not monitored. I did have a few times where the rice would boil over and had to use a plate under the unit as a precaution. It does what it is supposed to, is light, compact, and cheap. I will not be purchasing again and will try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Witt

customer_reviews.title: You had one job...and you did it well, cooker.
customer_reviews.text: I never used a rice cooker before this purchase. I always hated how my rice would get stuck to a pot and was always under- or over-cooked. This cooker solved that problem right away. Pretty much every grain of rice turns out exactly the way it should. I like the handy steamer that comes with it, but I've found that the steamer isn't too great when making rice at the same time (vegetables appear to turn out lukewarm and uncooked). It's better to just steam or just cook rice. Either way, a fine simple addition to your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: R. Amberg

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Simple, and Easy to Make Small Portions of Rice
customer_reviews.text: We eat rice everyday. But with our old rice cooker we were wasting a lot of it because we had to cook so much because our old rice cooker needed a higher minimum cups of rice for it to cook. We wanted a small rice cooker with not so many bells and whistles. You just press it down and let it cook. It can be used as a steamer too. It's quick on making rice too. We usually use the medium grain Japanese rice and the rice cooker cooks it perfectly. This was a really good buy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ainee

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was a tiny rice cooker. It does cook rice better than I do, however it does burn the rice. The second it pops lever to “warm” I take the pot out so that it stops heating. Even the. The rice is slightly brown on the bottom. ** Sadly the Teflon is already flaking off so I’m not able to use it anymore.**
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Breske

customer_reviews.title: super buy
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this now several times, and it has done a great job EVERY time. It's a bit tiny but handles the job. There is also a small steamer that sits on top the cooking rice. Extremely easy to use and clean and store. I am surprised at how much I enjoy its convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Cindyhasitall

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work. You turn it on to cook and within 8-10 minutes it pops as if done and there is water still standing inside and barely hot. I used this three times to make sure it wasn’t something on my part but each time it was me having to stand by it and keep pushing the cook button down until the rice was cook enough to use or put it in a frying pan to cook it that way. I bought this because my old aroma broke after 8 years of using it so I’m pretty dissatisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jaquelin

customer_reviews.title: It makes rice
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty simple. It makes rice. Put in rice. put in water. Press lever. Wait for ding. I have never used it for anything else. Its super easy to use and clean. Use the included plastic paddle and you wont scratch off the no stick coating. Seriously, you cant screw up rice with this.
customer_reviews.author: ksuwildkat

customer_reviews.title: Any of you who read this, must throw away your current rice cooker in the kitchen immediately
customer_reviews.text: Well, don't be offended by the title. I really meant to share my excitements on this tiny and nearly "free of charge" rice cooker. It is really easy to use, and most importantly, you will never have to think about this time the rice may not be fully cooked, like often happened to that $249 cooker in your kitchen. After I cooked and ate the first batch, I ordered another one for my lake house and will "retire" the old ones on both locations.
customer_reviews.author: Y M Chang

customer_reviews.title: U don’t have to worrying about over cooking your rice
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this little rice cooker! I didn’t have No problem I used 1 cup of rice for the first time and it’s still was a lot for me make sure to used the right measurement with the water than u Good. And I don’t have to worry about burning my rice over the stove no more Lol it’s stops when it finished and place it on Warm Automatically 👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Michico

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It looks pretty and the nonstick inner pot is nice but the auto shut off works sporadically if at all. I used it about 5 or 6 times and it only shut off automatically twice. I actually burned two pots of rice really badly - the smell stuck around for hours. By the time I decided it wasn't my fault that the thing wasn't working correctly, the 30 day return period was over and it was too late to return. We had a rice cooker previously that lasted for like five years before we had a problem. Maybe we just got a bad product but it certainly left a bad taste in my mouth. I was more than disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdy

customer_reviews.title: Yummy rice every time
customer_reviews.text: I've never been able to cook rice well...except for minute rice. This little rice cooker is perfect for my husband and me. Remember to wash the rice first, grease the bottom and sides of the cooker, and stir the rice into the liquid well and you'll get lovely rice each time. I've never had any trouble with the cooker dripping or the steam causing a problem. It's easy to operate...just one button to turn it on...and the lights indicate when it's cooking and when it's done. Easy! Then serve the rice, wipe out the cooking insert and put it into the dishwasher. That's all there is to the cleanup!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with product
customer_reviews.text: The steamer is very loose and the lid continually gets water in it making it a requirement to remove handle every time it is used so the water can be let out, dried off and screws replaced to use again. Very inconvenient very time consuming. Might as well use stovetop to make rice and or steam veggies.
customer_reviews.author: cinfulk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice every time!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It was cheap and it works great. No need to spend a bunch of money to have fluffy perfectly cooked rice. Brown rice, white rice, wild rice - it all comes out excellent! I also use it to steam veggies. Just set it up so the rice and veggies cook themselves while I'm sauteing some tofu :) It's simple to clean as well. If you don't use metal utensils on it and just stick to the plastic serving spoon provided, then your rice will very easily come out every time. I only wish there was a bigger size for additional serving sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Caresse Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well after awhile.
customer_reviews.text: When first used the first dozen times or so, I was pleased with the item. After continued use, notice inconsistencies in the out come of cooking 1 cup of rice. More "overflows" of liquid started occurring to the point where I do not use it anymore. You get what you pay for in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Meathead

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker with even better tasting rice.
customer_reviews.text: Really great product I use it very often. The only problem I’ve had and I’ve seen other people have. Is where it bubbles up and the water goes everywhere and leaves a mess. I think this happens when the water to rice ratio is too high but to fix it even if it is. You can just put the steamer attachment on even if you’re not steaming anything. Haven’t had it bubble once doing this.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: The two stars are for it’s appearance. The disappointment is because it is described as “ 6 cup” but that is not for the rice. That is for the rice and steamer basket which would both have to be full to the top to measure 6 cups of food in total. That is not enough for a family amd could overflow. It looks btter for a single serve or maybe a small portion eating pair.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Miniature the spoon is bigger than the pot
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than the one I bought a few years ago. No way this holds 6 cups of anything. More like 1-3 cups get real. My last one the spoon fit end to end in the Teflon pot this one the spoon is almost the size of the bottom. If there is a larger pot you need to buy that for a family.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give a very high rating because I didn't like that when I put it on keep warm it makes the rice very dry. Once it dried up, it sticks to the cooker making it harder to clean. I like that you can stem vegetable or salmon while cooking the rice. Although its nice that it can do multiple cooking at the same time, I would have to make sure that the meat is fully cook before eating it. Overall, I think it would be usable for a few months but I don't see myself using it for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Min Zhen Chen

customer_reviews.title: Scratches really fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker a while back, and it works quite well for the price! I am someone who is careful about the things I own, and the rice cooker scratched pretty fast. I have to admit to using a metal spoon once or twice to scoop and I was not expecting it to be that sensitive. The rice did start sticking after that, but no other problems. Works well for 2-3 people!
customer_reviews.author: Riya

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: Yes!!! I absolutely love this! Made my life as a momma so much easier! I’m enjoying spending tome with my family instead of in the kitchen, cooking, picking up, then dishes. I have 1 child, and a husband to feed. And fed all three of us with a little left over with just a cup of rice and 4 thighs of chicken❤️ I absolutely love this!!!! My kitchen was clean before dinner was even done, eating and now only have to rinse off the rice cooker and our plates❤️❤️ I love this so so so so much, this is my new favorite tool! Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wickert

customer_reviews.title: Poor performer
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last a year. Use it about once a week to make plain white rice. It would stop well short of when the rice was finished and if I was steaming vegetables thee vegetables would be under cooked. Won't recommend, won't buy again, not convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Huach Can

customer_reviews.title: Way way way too SMALL!
customer_reviews.text: Much much smaller than they said! Maybe one small plate of rice! Unless they are u set omg different “cup” than the actual one. Haven’t used it and don’t think I will but not worth of my time to go over the trouble of returning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker. I've tried to use it for things other than rice with not much success... but that could be my own failures and not the product. But for cooking rice, its great. My only real complaint is that the pressure release hole in the lid tends to spray rice steam everywhere, which gets anything near the cooker dirty. I also don't like that I have to unplug it and plug it back in for an on/off function. That aside though, it makes perfect rice easily, and its easy to wash (despite the steam mess.) The timed 'warm' feature is also nice incase I forget the rice was cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Jessimi Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Love the rice
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loving my rice cooker. I havnt used it for other things yet but the rice is amazing. Its not too wet, it's not a big blob it's the perfect temperature and taste. I was skeptical but man is this better. Im not a huge rice person and this has changed me.
customer_reviews.author: Dinahmo Garske

customer_reviews.title: It has worked well for us for approximately one year ...
customer_reviews.text: It has worked well for us for approximately one year. Then the cooker started to make some weird noises and the lid would rattle every time we use it. It's near the end of its life not only for reasons I just mentioned, but for the fact that the enamel is flaking off. Without this, the rice will not cook evenly, sometimes burn, or stick to the pot. If you are in the market of a low end rice cooker in which you will get about a years worth of use out it, then it should work well for you. Beware: it says it's a 6 cup rice cooker, but a full pot might only serve 4 people max.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with other buyers. This rice cooker makes a mess even if you are only cooking a small portion. The lid is not well fitted to the pot and does not provide a good seal, allowing steam and water to spray and bubble out along the rim. I have to put a towel underneath to catch all the overflow. Would not buy this brand of rice cooker again. My last mini rice cooker was a Hamilton and lasted over 6 years. I’ve only had this one for a year and already looking into a replacement to avoid future messes & hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Kaydee

customer_reviews.title: Spills out water for Brown Rice
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use Small Cooks perfect white rice Cons: Spills water everywhere when making brown rice You have to manually unplug it to turn it off or it will burn the rice on the warm setting
customer_reviews.author: Product Tester

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice the rice is cook well. If you put to much water it will over flow but if you but just the right amount it's good. So you should write down how much rice and cups of water you need so you won't forget
customer_reviews.author: Mimeka Simms

customer_reviews.title: No go.
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if it's common but it doesnt work well. It burns rice on the bottom. Takes hours to cook and then it's not evenly done. I followed the instructions then followed other peoples advice and it still dont work right. I've wasted 2-3 lbs of rice giving it every opportunity to be successful. 😖👎
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Montuori

customer_reviews.title: Did not turn to warm
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time ever using a rice cooker. I used this rice cooker three times. The first two times was great. One of the times I left the house while it was cooking. The third use, thankfully I was home. I was cooking when I started smelling burning and realized it was the rice cooker. It did not turn from 'cook' to 'warm'. So the rice started burning and smoking... That's pretty dangerous. I am returning it. But I liked it when it worked. Now I'd be nervous to use this brand again, or any rice cooker even. Now I know that I still need to watch the rice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this rice cooker for the price. Add 3 cups of dry rice, fill to water line in non-stick removable pot, put the lid on, flip the switch and in 20 minutes you have 6 cups of perfectly cooked rice. Every. Single. Time. It comes with its own measuring cup that now lives in the rice bag, it's own serving spoon/spatula and even has a small veggie steamer tray on top.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Best little rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker. My husbands grandmother has always used this to make her rice and it comes out PERFECT. So finally I went on a mission to find this exact rice cooker. Worked great as expected. The little paper with the package says 2 cups of rice will take 19-24 minutes to cook but I've found that it actually cooks rather fast, more like 15 minutes. It is small but we've always used this when we have dinners of like 5 people and it's always been enough! We are a small family of 3 so the small size was perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa N

customer_reviews.title: Great for children too.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. My 14 year old daughter uses it to prepare her lunch before leaving to school. Easy to use cooks fast. Easy to clean and we don’t need to pay attention to it and I’m worry free about her getting burn on a stove. Love this rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Maria V Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Edit: I've used the steamer tray. Ive steamed hot dogs and vegetables. I like the tray I love this rice cooker. Perfectly cooked rice Everytime. I've also used different kinds of rice and it works great for all of them. I was kinda surprised when I got it because it was smaller than I thought but it cooked plenty of rice for my little family. Haven't used the steam tray but I didn't buy it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Stephstuff

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had an Aroma rice cooker before it was great and I passed it on to my step daughter. My son was not very happy about that as he thought he was going to get it. This new rice cooker. Is not nearly as good as our last one. It burns the rice and is very hard to figure out how much water you need to make a good batch of rice. Having to “babysit” the “automatic rice cooker” is not my idea of how aa automatic rice cooker works. With the amount of work it takes to make rice with this pot. I should have saved my money and cook rice on the Stove Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ginnett

customer_reviews.title: doesn't make a mess if you think first.
customer_reviews.text: When I make rice, I just leave the steam basket in place to act as extra volume so that it doesn't spew rice starch everywhere. Not hard if you think about it, definitely doesn't deserve the low reviews by some of these geniuses.
customer_reviews.author: bikersquid

customer_reviews.title: but it actually is PERFECT! It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package and saw how small this really is, I was worried that it wouldn't be large enough to feed my family of 5, but it actually is PERFECT! It gets the job done, very easy to clean afterwards, and perfect storage size for small kitchens/apartments. Also, love the red color, classy & cute. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to help me cook rice easier, and this steams veggies at the same time so I LOVE it! The instructions were very clear and it was easy to use and measure out the rice and water! I love the color and it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Red Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: For the price and what it can do, this seems to be a solid addition to your kitchen. Build appears to be sturdy and it's simple to operate. I don't experience any mess after it does its job, but that's probably because it's mostly used to steam white rice. The blue lights add a nice touch too. Have only had it for 2 weeks and very satisfied with the purchase thus far, but will provide an update if any issues come up.
customer_reviews.author: Milpol

customer_reviews.title: Quit after a month.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a couple years ago, and it worked great...for a while. Thinking I overused it, I bought a new one. It quit after a month (used TWICE!) Both times it suddenly stopped cooking the rice for more than a couple of minutes. Really frustrating that it's literally two days past the return date that it's given up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Great Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rice cooker and the steamer tray comes in handy also. Halfway through cooking I will add steamer tray with vegetables or frozen shrimp. For a great nutritional mealThis is my second one in 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: SWB

customer_reviews.title: Great! But watch your amount!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve loved having this! We’ve yet to master it with basmati or brown rice, but the typical rice seems pretty great. Last week we followed the instructions and made two cups of brown rice, if we’d made anymore it would have overflowed- so just because there are more marks for more cups- doesn’t mean it’s always a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration after one use and washing
customer_reviews.text: Very strange and concerning! The inside pot for water and rice as well as the vegetable container became discolored after one use and washing. I am concerned that whatever the steel parts are coated with can seep into the food, Unsure if this product passes food health standards. I was attracted to the product because of its small size and efficiency, as well as it was a best seller.
customer_reviews.author: Angelic

customer_reviews.title: Good little thing.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a pretty great little machine. I do wish it had some sort of timer on it, especially to let me know when the rice is done. it frequently burns the rice even if it's only 5 minutes after it comes off from cook mode. This works fine for my husband and I, but I would definitely make some improvements if I could. The steam area is definitely not big enough for us! We like to eat a lot of veggies. Though, it is a good size for one person's portion of veggies. It steams chicken tenders very nicely. I am happy with what I purchased overall for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker works fine for me. Made my first batch of rice the other night and it came out just fine. Haven't used the steamer yet but Im sure it should also work fine. So if it doesnt I will let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Dbtx

customer_reviews.title: Fried out after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rice cooker in May and used it about once a week. Worked fine until this week. Plugged it in and within a minute, it smelled like burning electrical wires. Rice never cooked. Unplugged and plugged in and it did the same thing. Wasn't expensive but I would have expected it to last longer than that. Couldn't get a replacement because I threw it out because it stunk. Warranty voided because I couldn't give them a number off of the bottom of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Don’t freak out at its size
customer_reviews.text: When I received the box - I thought they had sent the wrong item. But this cooks just the right amount of rice for my family. I guess the machine is just smaller where it counts.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Hire

customer_reviews.title: Good rice cooker if you keep it to 1 cup or less.
customer_reviews.text: Any more than 1.5 cups of water makes a colossal mess. I routinely make 1.5 cups of brown rice which requires 2+ cups of water. Rice comes out great, but the starchy boiling water goes everywhere. I only use it on the stovetop, as cleaning that whole surface is the easiest (can’t clear enough space on the counter to avoid the flood of water). If you don’t mind a big clean up after each use, this does make a good pot of rice.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zuercher

customer_reviews.title: Makes A Mess Cooking Brown Rice
customer_reviews.text: SO disappointed with this cooker. I bought it to make brown rice. The first time I made brown rice it boiled over and made a huge puddle on the counter, and sprayed starchy steam as well. The second time I pre-rinsed the brown rice, and sprayed the top of the rice with non-stick cooking oil. This time it just spewed starchy steam all over, landing on counter, appliances, and floor. I bought this cooker to make cooking rice easy. I don't want to add oil or cooking spray to my food, and I certainly don't want to wash down my kitchen after I use it. I wish I never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann W.

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 9 months. Now I get to buy one that works better. This one switches to "warm", but then stays there forever - until you unplug it. Also, steam and goop gets everywhere. I don't know if that is standard for rice cookers, but it was surprising. Also this one was smaller than expected. Maybe for a 2 person household it would be big enough, but for our small 3 person family, something bigger would be better.
customer_reviews.author: L. fon

customer_reviews.title: Little Red Cook Pot short and Stout!😁
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THAT ITS RED and small. I work from home and this might be a rice cooker but I make rice, oatmeal, soup and whatever else comes to mind. If it ever stopped working I'd get another one, very convenient, SO KEEP THE PRICE REASONABLE!
customer_reviews.author: Leyah Flowers-Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a good price and it's very simple to use, just put in the rice and water and hit the switch. My only complaint would be that the coating on the inside of the pot scratches off super easy. This is the first one I've owned so I'm not sure if this is normal or not. Either way, I'm happy with my purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner morse

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: this is okay!! having never had a rice cooker/steamer befor i have nothing to compare this to!! but i think its okay, not the worst, not the best!! its easy to use & its smallish which is good for me but not for more than say 4 people. i think the price was fair for what i got plus i can now put the rice on & forget it!! i really like that!! i havent used the steamer basket yet but i see it working just fine! as always, you get what u pay for!! i will see how long it lasts before i decide whether to buy again but so far i am happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: cynde

customer_reviews.title: Leave the steamer bin on to avoid boiling over
customer_reviews.text: I went from a 12cup to the 6cup rice cooker. I wouldn't call it a 6 cup cooler but I guess if you babysit it with 2cup of dry you might get close to 6cups. For a dinner of one or two people it's great. I don't think it would work when I'm doing stir-fry for a group. Initially I kept having it boil/bubble over when I was cooking even 1cup of rice. Then I discovered if I left the steamer bin in place, it kept all but the most aggressive foaming from bubbling over. Now it's nearly a set-in-and-forget it cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any kitchen, steaming couldn't get any easier.
customer_reviews.text: This has held up exceptionally well over the past year or so that i've had it. Its a very simple design, very easy to use. put water in grey bowl inside the red pot. put veggies, etc in the silver mini pot above, click to cook, and wait 10 mins. BAM, CRUNCHY HEALTHIER STEAMED VEGGIES.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Easily scratched!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: This is a great rice cooker for 2-3 people. Very simple and basic which I love. Small and doesn't take much space. CONS: the inner pot is thinner than other rice cooker I had before, so the bottom of the rice gets slightly burned when you leave it on Warm function. The biggest issue is the non-stick coating of the inner pot gets very easily scratched even when I used the spatula that came with it! Now I'm afraid that chemical coating are flaking into my rice. I wonder if they replace the inner pot or sell inner pots on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Trex

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and so easy to use. It's just right for a small 1or 2 bedroom apartment. Or maybe you don't eat a lot of rice like my family. The vegetable steamer I only used once to steam some shrimp and it came out nice.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat the price. Works fairly well. ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat the price. Works fairly well. I found that stirring it at least once after 10 minutes helps the rice from getting crispy on the bottom. I found it cooks a little faster than the direction say. Cooks well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rosinski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome awesome awesome
customer_reviews.text: Before my son showed up I use this probably every third day, since he has showed up he has used this every single day. This is one of the most handy appliances I have ever bought and I am nearly 60 years old. I love it my son loves it it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: low capacity, makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second rice cooker for our cabin. The lid does not lock like other rice cookers, so the water seeps out over the sides and makes a big mess. It also is very small capacity. Might work well for a dorm room for one person..not for a family of 4. I didn't use it right away, now too late to return...so beware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little buy
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Can’t beat it
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is small and after reading the reviews again and seeing the product first hand its not worth the cost better time pay a little more and get a lot more for your money
customer_reviews.author: bonnie cooper

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly good
customer_reviews.text: This little rice cooker seemed like a great idea when cooking for 2. It does cook the rice but it also tend to boil over through the steam vent at the top. Makes a real mess on the counter unless you put a tray or bowl under it. Also the rice sometimes overcooks and a layer at the bottom is hard.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first rice cooker I've owned. I always thought having a rice cooker was stupid when you can just cook it on the stove. BUT NO! This thing is amazing. First of all, it makes the easy task of cooking rice EVEN EASIER. You literally just set and forget. And the steamer on top is great for veggies. I even made one of those rice cooker pancakes once and it was so good! Cooking brown rice takes some finagling but once you get the hang of it, works well. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The pot is too small and doesnt fit in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The pot is too small and doesnt fit in the red base right. Almost as if they cheaped out and just used parts from a smaller rice cooker that they had left over. Its wiggly and lose. The spring inside makes squeaky sounds and looks broken. Yes it cooked the rice i tried so it gets 2 stars. Honestly though it doesnt evem deserve that.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Unplug it as soon as the rice is done!
customer_reviews.text: The rice cooker works great for cooking the rice. However, as soon as the cooker switches from cooking to the warmer setting it needs to be unplugged! The rice will burn very quickly on the bottom if left on the warm setting. I haven’t used it for steaming yet.
customer_reviews.author: Billy N.

customer_reviews.title: Wife really likes it...
customer_reviews.text: We've only used the cooker a couple of times,but my wife really likes the way it cooks a meal perfectly. And whenever she's happy, I'm just ecstatic!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Steadham

customer_reviews.title: Efficient appliance
customer_reviews.text: Cooks rice so fast. Love that I can use it for veggies. Awesome, small perfect size for 2! Easy to use & clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: heating element burned out and it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: No idea why it failed as I was always careful with cleaning and use. It lasted just under 4 years. I'm sad it stopped working as it was a dream making rice this way. I purchased another from another company and hoping it lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Sorlie

customer_reviews.title: It cooks brown rice great, uniformly tender but not too soft
customer_reviews.text: We had a small B&D rice cooker that worked well enough with the brown rice we always use but tended to make a mess - spit a lot of water & foam out the steam hole and made a mess, even with a small cloth on top. With this one, use the upper basket even when cooking just rice and the foam almost entirely pops before reaching the steam hole so little or no mess. It cooks brown rice great, uniformly tender but not too soft, which can be a bit difficult to achieve reliably on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Cant cook 3 cups
customer_reviews.text: This product says it can cook 3 cups of uncooked rice. In the directions it says not to use US standard cups but gives you a smaller cup measure. It cannot handle any more than two of the smaller cup fulls. Any more than that and the rice will be hard and you will have to add water half cup by half cup until you get it right. Thats just stupid and you usually end up with wet and crunchy rice. Not worth it. Buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Aroma Housewares ARC-743-1NGR 6-Cup (Cooked) (3-Cup UNCOOKED) Pot Style Rice Cooker and Food Steamer,Red
product_meta.description: Color:RedEnjoy easy home cooking with the aroma 6 Cup (Cooked) pot style rice cooker and food steamer. Restaurant-quality rice. Healthy steamed meals. Delicious one-pot dishes. Prepare all this and more at the flip of a switch! Aroma takes the “cook” out of home cooking— turning kitchen time into your time! Help the kids with homework, get creative at play time or pick up that novel you've been waiting to dive into. All while delivering hot, hearty and healthy meals the entire family will love. This convenient cooker's compact Capacity perfectly cooks 2 to 6 Cups of any variety of rice. Once the rice has finished, it will automatically switch to keep-warm so there's no need for monitoring or stirring. The steam tray allows for healthy steaming of meats and vegetables, even as rice cooks below. It's also perfect for oatmeal, chili, jambalaya, soups and so much more! And when the cooking is done, the inner cooking pot and all accessories remove for easy cleanup in the dishwasher. Steam tray, rice measuring cup and serving spatula included.
feature_bullets: Perfectly prepares 2 to 6 cups of any variety of cooked rice
Steams meat and vegetables while rice cooks below
Simple, one-touch operation with automatic Keep-Warm
Great for soups, jambalaya, chili and so much more!
Includes Steam Tray, Rice Measuring Cup and Serving Spatula

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,277 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
